ground_truth: Daisy crawls into the makeshift den, and Benjamin follows on his hands and knees. Kneeling beneath the table, Benjamin strikes a match and carefully lights a candle, whose warm glow silhouettes them behind the white drapery. Daisy smiles. She gingerly reaches out to touch his smiling face. Benjamin holds her gaze as she touches his stubbly cheek. Miss Fuller whisks up the sheet, exposing them. Daisy obeys. Miss Fuller scowls at Benjamin. Wearing a nightgown, she starts up the stairs, using her cane. Dejected, Benjamin leans out of the den with his head hung. Queenie comes up from the basement in her dressing gown and catches sight of him kneeling in the shadows, staring at the floor. Suddenly resolute, Benjamin rises, resting on his cane. She embraces him. She gently strokes his back and kisses him on the forehead. She scratches her head thoughtfully as he walks away. Benjamin hooks his cane on the end of his bed and gets in. Old man Daws is in the bed opposite. Grainy old footage shows the lightning striking him. Sepia footage of Mr. Daws collapsing by a mailbox follows. Lying in his bed, Daws exhales a cloud of wispy, white cigarette smoke and stares off in thought. Benjamin turns onto his side and sinks down beneath the covers. Smiling, Oti takes a step back, then turns and walks briskly out of the door. Straight-backed and without the use of a cane, Benjamin goes to a window and peers out through narrowed eyes. Carrying a suitcase, Oti crosses the road below, bathed in the orange glow of a streetlamp. A woman with a dog sits beside Benjamin at a piano. He joins in, and they play together. Benjamin washes himself in the bath. He stares down. Caroline leaves Daisy's bedside. On TV, Hurricane Katrina is shown. A nurse arrives. They stand by a window at the foot of the bed. The nurse strides off to assist a colleague, and Caroline drifts over to the empty bed beside her mother's. Cast in cold, blue light from the window, she takes her hands out of the pockets of her dark body-warmer and sits cross-legged on the mattress with the diary in her lap. Mr. Daws sits beside him on a bench. Grainy footage shows lightning striking Mr. Daws in a field, sending up a plume of smoke. A man approaches them on the dock. The captain glances around. Benjamin looks at a young guy. Benjamin stands up. The bearded captain wears braces and a peaked cap. He nods. Benjamin boards the tugboat Chelsea. The captain leans out of the wheelhouse. He swabs the decks. In the wheelhouse, Mike leans towards Benjamin. Mike squints thoughtfully. Benjamin wears a searching expression.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Daisy creeps into the temporary refuge, and Benjamin trails on his palms and knees. Kneeling underneath the table, Benjamin ignites a match and cautiously kindles a candle, whose warm radiance outlines them behind the white curtain. Daisy grins. She delicately reaches out to caress his grinning visage. Benjamin maintains her look as she caresses his bristly cheek. Miss Fuller flutters up the sheet, revealing them. Daisy complies. Miss Fuller glares at Benjamin. Clad in a nightdress, she ascends the stairs, utilizing her walking stick. Crestfallen, Benjamin leans out of the refuge with his head lowered. Queenie emerges from the cellar in her robe and glimpses him kneeling in the darkness, gazing at the ground. Suddenly determined, Benjamin stands, leaning on his walking stick. She hugs him. She gently caresses his back and kisses him on the brow. She scratches her head pensively as he departs. Benjamin hooks his walking stick on the end of his bed and climbs in. Old man Daws is in the bed across. Grainy old video shows the lightning striking him. Sepia video of Mr. Daws collapsing by a mailbox follows. Reclining in his bed, Daws exhales a puff of wispy, white cigarette smoke and gazes off in contemplation. Benjamin turns onto his flank and sinks down beneath the blankets. Grinning, Oti steps back, then turns and strides briskly out of the doorway. Erect and without the use of a walking stick, Benjamin goes to a window and looks out through narrowed eyes. Carrying a suitcase, Oti crosses the street below, bathed in the orange radiance of a streetlamp. A woman with a canine sits beside Benjamin at a piano. He joins in, and they perform together. Benjamin cleanses himself in the tub. He gazes down. Caroline departs from Daisy's bedside. On TV, Hurricane Katrina is displayed. A nurse arrives. They stand by a window at the foot of the bed. The nurse strides off to aid a colleague, and Caroline drifts over to the vacant bed beside her mother's. Cast in cool, blue illumination from the window, she removes her hands from the pockets of her dark vest and sits cross-legged on the mattress with the journal in her lap. Mr. Daws sits beside him on a bench. Grainy video shows lightning striking Mr. Daws in a field, sending up a plume of smoke. A man approaches them on the pier. The captain looks around. Benjamin gazes at a young fellow. Benjamin stands. The bearded captain wears suspenders and a peaked cap. He nods. Benjamin boards the tugboat Chelsea. The captain leans out of the wheelhouse. He mops the decks. In the wheelhouse, Mike leans towards Benjamin. Mike squints pensively. Benjamin wears a searching expression.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Daisy crawls into the makeshift den, and she is followed by Benjamin on his hands and knees. Kneeling beneath the table, a match is struck by Benjamin, and a candle is carefully lit by him, whose warm glow silhouettes them behind the white drapery. Daisy smiles. Her hand is gingerly reached out to touch his smiling face. Her gaze is held by Benjamin as his stubbly cheek is touched by her. The sheet is whisked up by Miss Fuller, exposing them. Daisy obeys. Benjamin is scowled at by Miss Fuller. Wearing a nightgown, the stairs are started up by her, using her cane. Dejected, the den is leaned out of by Benjamin with his head hung. Queenie comes up from the basement in her dressing gown and catches sight of him kneeling in the shadows, with his eyes staring at the floor. Suddenly resolute, Benjamin rises, resting on his cane. He is embraced by her. His back is gently stroked, and he is kissed on the forehead by her. She scratches her head thoughtfully as he walks away. Benjamin hooks his cane on the end of his bed and gets in. In the bed opposite is Old man Daws. Grainy old footage shows the lightning striking him. Sepia footage follows Mr. Daws collapsing by a mailbox. Lying in his bed, a cloud of wispy, white cigarette smoke is exhaled by Daws, and he stares off in thought. The covers are sunk down beneath by Benjamin as he turns onto his side. Smiling, a step is taken back by Oti, then a turn is made, and the door is briskly walked out of by him. Straight-backed and without the use of a cane, a window is approached by Benjamin, and he peers out through narrowed eyes. Carrying a suitcase, the road is crossed by Oti below, bathed in the orange glow of a streetlamp. A woman with a dog sits beside Benjamin at a piano. He joins in, and the piano is played together by them. Benjamin washes himself in the bath. He stares down. Daisy's bedside is left by Caroline. On TV, Hurricane Katrina is shown. A nurse arrives. They stand by a window at the foot of the bed. A colleague is assisted by the nurse, who strides off, and the empty bed beside her mother's is drifted over to by Caroline. Cast in cold, blue light from the window, her hands are taken out of the pockets of her dark body-warmer, and she sits cross-legged on the mattress with the diary in her lap. Beside him on a bench sits Mr. Daws. Grainy footage shows Mr. Daws being struck by lightning in a field, sending up a plume of smoke. A man approaches them on the dock. The captain glances around. A young guy is looked at by Benjamin. Benjamin stands up. The bearded captain wears braces and a peaked cap. He nods. The tugboat Chelsea is boarded by Benjamin. The wheelhouse is leaned out of by the captain. The decks are swabbed by him. In the wheelhouse, Benjamin is leaned towards by Mike. Mike squints thoughtfully. A searching expression is worn by Benjamin.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Daisy crawls into the makeshift den, with Benjamin following on his hands and knees. Under the table, he lights a candle, its glow silhouetting them behind white drapery. Daisy touches his smiling face, and he holds her gaze. Miss Fuller raises the sheet, revealing them, and scowls at Benjamin. Wearing a nightgown, she ascends the stairs with her cane. Dejected, Benjamin emerges from the den. Queenie, in her dressing gown, sees him kneeling in shadows. Resolute, Benjamin rises with his cane. She embraces and kisses him on the forehead. Thoughtfully, she watches him leave. Benjamin hooks his cane on his bed and lies down. Opposite, Old man Daws exudes a cloud of cigarette smoke, staring thoughtfully. Benjamin turns onto his side. Smiling, Oti steps back, briskly exits, and crosses the street under a streetlamp's glow. A woman with her dog joins Benjamin at a piano, and they play together. Benjamin bathes, staring down. Caroline departs Daisy's bedside. Hurricane Katrina plays on TV as a nurse arrives. By the window, Caroline drifts to the empty bed and sits cross-legged, diary in lap. Mr. Daws sits on a bench. Grainy footage shows him struck by lightning in a field. A man approaches them on the dock. The captain, wearing braces and a peaked cap, nods as Benjamin boards the tugboat Chelsea. Mike, squinting thoughtfully, leans toward Benjamin in the wheelhouse, both wearing searching expressions.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Daisy crawls into the makeshift den, followed by Benjamin on his hands and knees. Beneath the table, Benjamin lights a candle, casting warm silhouettes on the drapery. Daisy smiles and touches his cheek. Miss Fuller lifts the sheet, exposing them. Benjamin, dejected, leans out of the den. Queenie sees him, kneeling in the shadows, and embraces him. She strokes his back and kisses his forehead. Benjamin, thoughtful, gets into bed opposite old man Daws. Grainy footage shows Daws struck by lightning and collapsing by a mailbox. Daws exudes cigarette smoke, deep in thought. Benjamin turns beneath the covers. Oti leaves, crossing the street under a streetlamp's glow. A woman with a dog sits beside Benjamin at a piano, and they play together. Benjamin bathes and stares down. Caroline leaves Daisy's bedside. Hurricane Katrina is on TV. A nurse arrives and then leaves. Caroline sits cross-legged on a bed with a diary. Mr. Daws appears on a bench beside Benjamin, with footage of him struck by lightning. A man approaches on the dock. The captain nods, and Benjamin boards the tugboat Chelsea. The captain swabs the decks while Mike leans towards Benjamin in the wheelhouse, both wearing searching expressions.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Daisy slowly and carefully crawls into the cozy makeshift den they've created, and shortly thereafter, Benjamin follows on his hands and knees with a playful demeanor. Kneeling down beneath the low-hanging table, Benjamin strikes a match with steady hands and attentively lights a candle. The warm, flickering glow casts their silhouettes in an enchanting display behind the soft, white drapery. Daisy, with a gentle and affectionate smile, gingerly reaches out with her hand to tenderly touch his smiling face. Benjamin holds her gaze intently as her fingers gently brush against his stubbly, rough-hewn cheek. Just then, Miss Fuller quickly whisks up the sheet covering their den, suddenly exposing them. Daisy, understanding the situation, dutifully obeys. Miss Fuller scowls disapprovingly at Benjamin, and wearing her nightgown, she slowly starts her ascent up the stairs, using her cane for support. Feeling a sense of dejection, Benjamin leans out of the cozy den, his head hung low with disappointment. Emerging quietly from the basement in her comfortable dressing gown, Queenie catches sight of him kneeling there in the shadows, staring despondently at the floor. Becoming suddenly resolute, Benjamin rises, leaning heavily on his cane for support. She embraces him warmly, offering comfort. She gently strokes his back and plants a tender kiss on his forehead. She scratches her head thoughtfully, pondering, as he walks away. Benjamin methodically hooks his cane on the end of his bed and climbs in. Across from him, in the bed opposite, is the old man Daws. Grainy old footage plays, showing the moment lightning struck him. Following that is sepia-toned footage of Mr. Daws collapsing by a lonely mailbox. Lying in his bed, Daws exhales a cloud of wispy, white cigarette smoke and stares off into space, lost in thought. Benjamin turns onto his side, seeking comfort, and sinks slowly beneath the covers. Smiling softly, Oti takes a step back, then decisively turns and walks briskly out of the door. Standing straight-backed and without needing the aid of a cane, Benjamin goes over to a window and peers out through narrowed eyes, looking contemplative. Down below, carrying a suitcase, Oti crosses the street, bathed in the soft, orange glow of a streetlamp. Beside Benjamin at a piano sits a woman with a dog, and together, they begin to play in harmony. Benjamin diligently washes himself in the bath, and he gazes down, perhaps lost in deep thought. Caroline, having been at Daisy's bedside, departs thoughtfully. On the television, dire news footage of Hurricane Katrina is being shown. A nurse arrives, and together they stand by a window at the foot of the bed. The nurse then strides off purposefully to assist a colleague, leaving Caroline to drift over thoughtfully to the empty bed beside her mother's. Cast in cold, blue light streaming in from the window, she takes her hands out of the pockets of her dark body-warmer and assumes a cross-legged position on the mattress, the diary resting contemplatively in her lap. Mr. Daws sits beside him on a bench, both absorbing the quietude of the moment. Grainy footage captures the moment when lightning strikes Mr. Daws in a field, sending up an alarming plume of smoke. A man approaches them casually on the dock. The captain glances around with a seasoned air. Benjamin takes note and looks with curiosity at a young guy. Rising to his feet, Benjamin observes as the bearded captain, wearing braces and a peaked cap, nods in acknowledgment. Benjamin boards the weathered tugboat Chelsea with a sense of purpose. The captain leans out of the wheelhouse with ease. He diligently swabs the decks, maintaining order. In the wheelhouse, Mike leans in closer towards Benjamin, squinting thoughtfully. Benjamin wears a searching expression, trying to piece it all together.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Daisy carefully and slowly makes her way into the cozy, inviting makeshift den they have meticulously created, and shortly thereafter, Benjamin follows playfully, crawling on his hands and knees with a lighthearted demeanor. Kneeling beneath the low-hanging table, Benjamin expertly strikes a match with steady hands and attentively lights a candle. The candle’s warm, flickering glow casts enchanting silhouettes behind the soft, white drapery, creating an atmospheric ambiance. With a gentle and affectionate smile, Daisy gingerly reaches out with her hand, tenderly touching his smiling face. Benjamin holds her gaze intently, and her fingers gently brush against his stubbly, rough-hewn cheek. Suddenly, Miss Fuller swiftly whisks up the sheet that is covering their den, abruptly exposing them. Daisy, understanding the situation, dutifully complies. Miss Fuller scowls disapprovingly at Benjamin, and wearing her nightgown, she slowly begins her ascent up the stairs, using her cane for necessary support. Feeling a sense of dejection, Benjamin leans out of the cozy den, his head hung low in a state of disappointment. Quietly emerging from the basement in her comfortable dressing gown, Queenie spots him kneeling there in the shadows, staring despondently at the floor. Becoming suddenly resolute, Benjamin rises, leaning heavily on his cane for support. She embraces him warmly, offering tender comfort. She gently strokes his back and plants a tender kiss on his forehead. She scratches her head thoughtfully, pondering deeply, as he slowly walks away. Benjamin methodically hooks his cane on the end of his bed and climbs in. Across from him, in the bed opposite, lies the old man Daws. Grainy old footage plays, capturing the moment when lightning struck him. Following that is sepia-toned footage of Mr. Daws collapsing next to a lonely mailbox. Lying in his bed, Daws exhales a cloud of wispy, white cigarette smoke and stares off into space, completely lost in thought. Seeking comfort, Benjamin turns onto his side and sinks slowly beneath the covers. Smiling softly, Oti takes a step back, then decisively turns and walks briskly out of the door. Standing straight-backed, without the need for a cane, Benjamin walks over to a window and peers out through narrowed eyes, looking contemplative. Down below, crossing the street with a suitcase in hand, Oti is bathed in the soft, orange glow of a streetlamp. Beside Benjamin at a piano sits a woman with a dog, and together, they begin to play in beautiful harmony. Benjamin diligently washes himself in the bath, gazing thoughtfully downwards, perhaps lost in deep contemplation. Caroline, having been at Daisy’s bedside, departs thoughtfully. On the television, dire and serious news footage of Hurricane Katrina is being shown. A nurse arrives, and together they stand by a window at the foot of the bed. The nurse then strides off purposefully to assist a colleague, leaving Caroline to drift over thoughtfully to the empty bed beside her mother’s. Cast in the cold, blue light streaming in from the window, she takes her hands out of the pockets of her dark body-warmer and assumes a cross-legged position on the mattress, the diary resting contemplatively in her lap. Mr. Daws sits beside him on a bench, both absorbing the tranquil quietude of the moment. Grainy footage captures the moment when lightning strikes Mr. Daws in a field, sending up an alarming plume of smoke. A man approaches them casually on the dock. The seasoned captain glances around with an experienced air. Benjamin takes note and looks with curious interest at a young guy. Rising to his feet, Benjamin observes as the bearded captain, wearing braces and a peaked cap, nods in acknowledgment. With a sense of purpose, Benjamin boards the weathered tugboat Chelsea. The captain leans out of the wheelhouse with practiced ease. He diligently swabs the decks, maintaining a sense of order. In the wheelhouse, Mike leans in closer towards Benjamin, squinting thoughtfully. Benjamin wears a searching expression, as if trying to piece all of it together.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Daisy slowly crawls into the makeshift den, carefully maneuvering her body to fit beneath the low-hanging cloth, and Benjamin promptly follows her, shifting to his hands and knees to navigate the cramped space. As they both settle into the den, kneeling beneath the table's confines, Benjamin reaches into his pocket, retrieves a match, and with deliberate precision, strikes it against the box, producing a small flame. Gently, he moves the lit match to the candlewick, igniting it until the candle's warm glow gently illuminates the space around them, casting their silhouettes against the white drapery. Captivated by the moment, Daisy offers a soft smile and extends her hand, carefully reaching out to connect with Benjamin's face. As she delicately touches his cheek, she feels the roughness of his stubble, maintaining eye contact and sharing a silent moment with him. Suddenly, the private atmosphere is disrupted as Miss Fuller abruptly lifts the sheet, unveiling their hidden sanctuary. Without hesitation, Daisy complies with Miss Fuller's silent command, and as she rises, Miss Fuller casts a disapproving scowl towards Benjamin. In her nightgown, holding her cane for support, Miss Fuller turns and begins her ascent up the stairs. Left in the aftermath of the intrusion, Benjamin feels a wave of dejection wash over him, causing him to lean out of the den with his head lowered in dismay. As Queenie emerges from the basement, dressed in her dressing gown, she notices Benjamin kneeling in the dim shadows and fixating his gaze on the floor. With a sudden shift in resolve, Benjamin gathers his strength to rise, leaning on his cane for support. Queenie approaches him with warmth, wrapping her arms around him and offering reassurance with gentle strokes on his back, following with a tender kiss on his forehead. As Benjamin turns to leave, Queenie thoughtfully scratches her head, contemplating his situation. Upon reaching his room, Benjamin hooks his cane onto the end of his bed frame before climbing in, settling beneath the covers. Across from him, Old Man Daws occupies the opposite bed, and grainy old footage plays in Benjamin's mind, depicting lightning striking Daws, followed by sepia-toned scenes of him collapsing near a mailbox. Lying in his bed, Daws releases a cloud of wispy, white cigarette smoke, his gaze distant and pensive. Benjamin shifts onto his side, allowing himself to sink further beneath the covers for comfort. Meanwhile, Oti steps back, a smile gracing her lips, before turning briskly and exiting through the door. Benjamin, no longer reliant on his cane, stands straight-backed and makes his way to the window, peering out with narrowed eyes. Below, under the orange glow of a streetlamp, Oti crosses the road while carrying a suitcase. Inside, a woman accompanied by her dog takes a seat beside Benjamin at the piano; he joins her, and together they play in harmonious unison. Later, Benjamin bathes, washing himself methodically, occasionally pausing to stare down introspectively. In another scene, Caroline departs from Daisy's bedside, and the TV broadcasts scenes of the impending Hurricane Katrina. A nurse arrives to check in, and they briefly stand by the window at the foot of the bed before the nurse strides off to assist a colleague. Caroline drifts towards the empty bed adjacent to her mother's, and enveloped in the cold, blue light filtering through the window, she withdraws her hands from the pockets of her dark body-warmer and sits cross-legged on the mattress with a diary placed in her lap. In a flashback, Mr. Daws sits next to Benjamin on a bench as grainy footage replays the moment lightning strikes him in a field, sending up a dramatic plume of smoke. Back in the present, a man approaches Benjamin and Mr. Daws on the dock, catching their attention. The captain, distinguished by his bearded visage, braces, and peaked cap, surveys the scene around him. Benjamin locks eyes with a young guy, prompting him to stand up and acknowledge the situation. The captain offers a nod of affirmation as Benjamin boards the tugboat Chelsea. From the wheelhouse, the captain leans out to observe the deck. Meanwhile, Mike, positioned in the wheelhouse, leans towards Benjamin, squinting with thoughtful intent. Benjamin, too, bears a searching expression as he contemplates the unfolding events.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Daisy and Benjamin crawl into the makeshift den under the table, where Benjamin lights a candle, casting a warm glow around them. Daisy reaches out to touch Benjamin’s face, and they share a moment before Miss Fuller interrupts, scowling at Benjamin as she heads upstairs with her cane. Dejected, Benjamin emerges from the den, and Queenie, seeing him, embraces him tenderly before he retreats to his bed. Opposite him, Old Man Daws smokes thoughtfully, his past misfortunes captured in grainy footage. Benjamin settles into his own bed as Oti exits briskly, crossing the road with a suitcase under the streetlamp's glow. Later, Benjamin joins a woman at the piano, playing together, before he bathes in contemplation. Caroline leaves Daisy's bedside, watching the televised Hurricane Katrina, and takes a moment for herself by the window. She then sits with a diary in her lap, cast in the window's cold, blue light. Meanwhile, on a bench beside Benjamin, Mr. Daws recalls lightning striking him, captured again in grainy footage. On the dock, Benjamin boards the tugboat Chelsea with the captain’s nod of approval, observing the bustling activity and exchanging thoughtful expressions with Mike in the wheelhouse.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Daisy crawls into the makeshift den, a cozy space they crafted from furniture and sheets, and Benjamin follows on his hands and knees. Kneeling beneath the table, an old oak antique passed down through generations, Benjamin strikes a match he found in a drawer and carefully lights a candle, whose warm glow silhouettes them behind the white drapery. Daisy smiles. She gingerly reaches out to touch his smiling face, feeling the roughness that comes from a day spent in the sun. Benjamin holds her gaze as she touches his stubbly cheek. Miss Fuller, their strict but caring housekeeper, whisks up the sheet, exposing them in their secret hideaway. Daisy obeys her sharp command. Miss Fuller scowls at Benjamin. Wearing a nightgown, one she had since she was young, she starts up the stairs, using her cane inherited from her own mother. Dejected, Benjamin leans out of the den with his head hung low. Queenie, the warm-hearted woman who raised him, comes up from the dimly lit basement in her dressing gown and catches sight of him kneeling in the shadows, staring at the floor. Suddenly resolute, finding a new strength within, Benjamin rises, resting on his cane, carved from an old hickory branch. She embraces him with the tenderness of a mother. She gently strokes his back and kisses him on the forehead, her affection never waning. She scratches her head thoughtfully as he walks away, contemplating the future. Benjamin hooks his cane on the end of his bed and gets in. Old man Daws is in the bed opposite, a fellow resident in the boarding house. Grainy old footage shows the lightning striking him during a storm in his youth. Sepia footage of Mr. Daws collapsing by a mailbox, where he used to receive letters from a distant lover, follows. Lying in his bed, Daws exhales a cloud of wispy, white cigarette smoke and stares off in thought, reflecting on a life full of adventures. Benjamin turns onto his side and sinks down beneath the covers. Smiling, Oti, Benjamin's close friend from their days at sea, takes a step back, then turns and walks briskly out of the door. Straight-backed and without the use of a cane, Benjamin goes to a window and peers out through narrowed eyes. Carrying a suitcase, Oti crosses the road below, bathed in the orange glow of a streetlamp that flickers occasionally, adding to the nighttime ambiance. A woman with a dog, an old retriever known for its friendliness, sits beside Benjamin at a piano. He joins in, and they play together, creating a harmonious duet. Benjamin washes himself in the bath, the water warm and soothing. He stares down, lost in his thoughts. Caroline leaves Daisy's bedside. On TV, Hurricane Katrina, a devastating storm that struck in 2005, is shown. A nurse arrives, her shoes squeaking on the floor. They stand by a window at the foot of the bed, the sky outside dark and brooding. The nurse strides off to assist a colleague, and Caroline drifts over to the empty bed beside her mother's. Cast in cold, blue light from the window, she takes her hands out of the pockets of her dark body-warmer and sits cross-legged on the mattress with the diary in her lap, a record of her mother's life. Mr. Daws sits beside him on a bench, sharing a moment of quiet companionship. Grainy footage shows lightning striking Mr. Daws in a field, an event that has become part of local legend, sending up a plume of smoke. A man approaches them on the dock, where fishing boats are moored. The captain, known for his stern demeanor but hidden kindness, glances around. Benjamin looks at a young guy, perhaps a new crew member. Benjamin stands up with determination. The bearded captain wears braces and a peaked cap, reminiscent of an era gone by. He nods, acknowledging Benjamin's presence. Benjamin boards the tugboat Chelsea, a vessel known for its reliability. The captain leans out of the wheelhouse, his domain on the boat, and he swabs the decks, keeping them shipshape. In the wheelhouse, Mike, the first mate known for his keen insights, leans towards Benjamin. Mike squints thoughtfully, considering the journey ahead. Benjamin wears a searching expression, eager for the next adventure to unfold.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Daisy crawls into the makeshift den and Benjamin follows on his hands and knees. Kneeling beneath the table Benjamin strikes a match and carefully lights a candle whose warm glow silhouettes them behind the white drapery. Daisy smiles. She gingerly reaches out to touch his smiling face. Benjamin holds her gaze as she touches his stubbly cheek. Miss Fuller whisks up the sheet exposing them. Daisy obeys. Miss Fuller scowls at Benjamin. Wearing a nightgown she starts up the stairs using her cane. Dejected Benjamin leans out of the den with his head hung. Queenie comes up from the basement in her dressing gown and catches sight of him kneeling in the shadows staring at the floor. Suddenly resolute Benjamin rises resting on his cane. She embraces him. She gently strokes his back and kisses him on the forehead. She scratches her head thoughtfully as he walks away. Benjamin hooks his cane on the end of his bed and gets in. Old man Daws is in the bed opposite. Grainy old footage shows the lightning striking him. Sepia footage of Mr Daws collapsing by a mailbox follows. Lying in his bed Daws exhales a cloud of wispy white cigarette smoke and stares off in thought. Benjamin turns onto his side and sinks down beneath the covers. Smiling Oti takes a step back then turns and walks briskly out of the door. Straightbacked and without the use of a cane Benjamin goes to a window and peers out through narrowed eyes. Carrying a suitcase Oti crosses the road below bathed in the orange glow of a streetlamp. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. test_cases.name: Action Corruption

She cautiously attempts to tickle his thoughtful face. Benjamin averts her gaze as she brushes against his stubbly cheek. Miss Fuller swipes up the sheet, revealing them. Daisy hesitates. She nudges him. She tenderly pats his back and winks at him on the forehead. She ponders thoughtfully as he wanders away. Benjamin flings his cane on the end of his bed and lies on it. He polishes the railings. In the bridge, Logan leans towards Gregory. Logan peers inquisitively. Gregory wears a pondering demeanor.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Daisy and Benjamin crawl into a makeshift den, where Benjamin lights a candle, casting a warm glow. Daisy gently touches his face, but Miss Fuller interrupts, scowling at Benjamin. Dejected, he exits and leans on his cane. Queenie sees Benjamin in the shadows, offers comfort, and he walks away thoughtfully. In their shared room, Benjamin hooks his cane on the bed and lies down, mirroring the old footage of Mr. Daws being struck by lightning. Daws ponders while smoking. Oti leaves the room, carrying a suitcase under a streetlamp’s glow. Benjamin, unaided by a cane, watches her departure. He plays piano with a woman, washes himself, and reflects. Meanwhile, Caroline leaves Daisy's side during Hurricane Katrina’s news coverage. She sits with a diary on an empty bed, illuminated by cold window light. Mr. Daws, seen again in footage, is struck by lightning, sending up smoke. Benjamin and a captain exchange nods as Benjamin boards the tugboat Chelsea, where Mike squints at him thoughtfully, and Benjamin wears a searching expression.
